## Natural history notes

The Sandhill Pinweed (Lechea torreyi) is a species of perennial flowering plant native to the U.S. southeast coastal plain. It occurs in sandy, fire-dependent pine habitats of the southeast including pine flatwoods, longleaf pine sandhill, and pine barrens. The genus name Lechea honors Johan Leche (1704â€“1764), a Swedish botanist and meteorologist. It has two recognized varieties: var. torreyi and var. congesta, differing in how tightly the floral panicles are clustered and the coloration of inner sepals in fruit.
